qas.question: What year did the Strasbourg tramway open?

answers.text: regional transit company Compagnie des Transports Strasbourgeois

context: City transportation in Strasbourg includes the <b5_0>futurist-looking<b5_0/> Strasbourg tramway that opened in <a0_0><b6_0><b9_0>1994<b9_0/><b6_0/><a0_0/> and is operated by the <a1_0>regional transit company Compagnie des Transports Strasbourgeois<a1_0/> (CTS), consisting of <a2_0>6<a2_0/> lines with a total length of <a3_0><b7_0>55.8 km<b7_0/><a3_0/> (<b8_0>34.7 mi<b8_0/>). The CTS also operates a comprehensive bus network throughout the city that is integrated with the trams. With more than <a4_0>500 km<a4_0/> (311 mi) of bicycle paths, biking in the city is convenient and the CTS operates a cheap bike-sharing scheme named Vélhop'. The CTS, and its predecessors, also operated a previous generation of tram system between 1878 and 1960, complemented by trolleybus routes between 1939 and 1962.
